subject: RE: [junit] Sun doesn't use JUnit. Why?
msgSnippet: ... That s simply not true. First, you can use the optional script task to embedd scripts written in different languages (Javascript, for example) into your
messageBody:
> 1) requiring java code for customization, as it applies to doing
> things you'd typically do with a script for quick turnaround

That's simply not true.

First, you can use the optional script task to embedd scripts written in
different languages (Javascript, for example) into your build script -
with full access to all ant features.

Second, you can always use the exec task to invoke an external tool like
make would do. Admittedly Ant is a little bit more verbose here, but it
also adds conditional execution based on the operating system in return.

Regards, Ilja
